description: APPLICATION FOR A LAWFUL DEVELOPMENT CERTIFICATE IN RESPECT OF REPLACEMENT OF EXISTING MANSARD ROOF EXTENSION WITH A NEW DORMER, THE REPLACEMENT OF FRONT ROOFLIGHTS AND THE ERECTION OF A NEW DORMER ROOF EXTENSION ABOVE OUTRIGGER
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The proposed rear dormer work and outrigger dormer would consist of the enlargement of a dwelling house within the meaning of Class B of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class B. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.
Condition : 2 - The proposed front slope roof light would consist of any other alteration to the roof of the dwelling house within the meaning of Class C of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class C. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.
Condition : 3 - INFORMATIVE
The applicant should be aware that the site may provide a useful habitat for swifts. Swifts are currently in decline in the UK and in order to encourage and improve the conservation of swifts the applicant is advised to consider the installation of swift nesting box/bricks on site.
Condition : 4 - INFORMATIVE - Bricks

The Council as local planning authority, recognizes the importance of achieving high standards of site practice and workmanship in the course of construction and acknowledges that this will have significant influence upon the quality of the finished brickwork.

The applicant is therefore encouraged to follow the advice set out in the Brick Development Association publication: Good site practice and workmanship (December 2015)  https://www.brick.org.uk/admin/resources/g-good-site-practice-workmanship.pdf when implementing the development hereby approved.
Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE
Building Regulations 
Please note that this is a planning permission only and you may also require approval under the Building Regulations. If you are in any doubt about this you can get further information via https://www.merton.gov.uk/planning-and-buildings/building-control  or by emailing building.control@merton.gov.uk.
Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE (Party Wall Act) - The applicant is advised to check the requirements of the Party Wall Act 1996 relating to work on an existing wall shared with another property, building on the boundary with a neighbouring property, or excavating near a neighbouring building. Further information is available at the following link: 
https://www.gov.uk/party-walls-building-works
Condition : 7 - INFORMATIVE
The applicant is advised to contact Merton Council's Waste Services Team on 020 8274 4902 for detailed design guidance on waste and recycling storage facilities.
